intro: Emerus puniceus, commonly known as the red spurflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs. Emerus puniceus thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a striking addition to arid landscapes.
